page.title: 05 TRANSPORT IN MAIDSTONE
page.content: Within Maidstone there are a variety of{transport types: the River {Medway, an extensive road network and {two railway}lines. Some have declined, while others have flourished. The{River}Medway, once used for transportation purposes, is now useful for{leisure}activities - boats, walks and fishing.There are signs showing where industry was sited in the past to use the river. The two{railway}lines serve to link Maidstone with London and the South coast. It provides an important {commuter}link and has three stations. {Roads}radiate from Maidstone - the most important being the M20,the A20 and the A229. Kent County Council has a Â£30 million scheme to ease traffic congestion in the near future. by Jane Todd and Cathy Lambert
